LanguageData.QuestTimeout: Time to complete the quest {0} has expired
LanguageData.SupportFullDoomsday: Help is fully staffed. You can not take more frctions.
LanguageData.DiscussWithOtherFactions: Discuss the event with other factions.
LanguageData.DoomsdayDesc: The {0} faction gathered to arrange a kawabanga on this planet. We can try to collect the missing amount, or maybe other factions will be able to help in the raid on their base?
LanguageData.Help_AskResouces: The {0} faction remembers its duty and sends you the resources that it was able to collect. {1}
LanguageData.Help_AskPower: The faction {0} remembers its duty and sends you a group of its fighters to support your settlement.
LanguageData.UsingCaravan: The faction technology does not allow it to use capsules, so they sent a caravan.
LanguageData.GiftHasBeenDropped: Resources left close to your colony. (click that go)
LanguageData.AssistCaravan_GifterArrived: A friendly squad arrived at your request. They will leave things near your colony.
LanguageData.ClimateBombDesc: We found a climate bomb. Thoughts in my head mixed up. Who and why left it on this planet is not clear, but we need to neutralize it, if we don’t want the next couple of seasons to have anything happen to our climate. \n\nWe need to assemble a good squad, most likely there will be enemy factions, probably will be tied the battle.
LanguageData.Comm_MassiveFireDesc: Near our settlement a fire broke out, probably caused by the weather. With every minute it inflames more and more. It is fraught with ignition of neighboring lands, including ours. \nWe can hope for rain or try to put it out ourselves.
LanguageData.Comm_ShipCrashDesc: We saw a ship crash. In appearance - a general purpose ship. When it fell, it fell apart, some of them were large, some small. These are probably cargo and living compartments. \nThe ship's parts are scattered all over the planet. The plating of the ship is made of plastal, so probably a lot could have survived. You can form a caravan and see what remains of the compartments, taking the contents yourself. True, such a profit is likely to attract uninvited guests.
LanguageData.Comm_SiegeCampDesc: Not far from us the camp of gangsters was founded. They have mortars and a desire to kill us. They will attack us at short intervals, simultaneously rebuilding their camp and increasing their combat power. We need to destroy him as soon as possible, before he becomes a real problem.
LanguageData.EmailMessageReceived: You have received a message from {0} on the topic {1}. You can view it in the mailbox, in Geoscape.
LanguageData.ScoutingComp_InfoTitle: Greetings I am sending you information from our intelligence officers that they were able to collect for your settlement. The report indicates the danger and the estimated time.\n\n
LanguageData.ScoutingComp_NoThreatsInfoTitle: Greetings After several days of absence, our scouts finally returned. They did not detect any looming threats.
LanguageData.CommOption_SubscribeScout_SubTitle:
Intelligence agreement

By signing the agreement, the faction with which it was signed will send the results of intelligence of its people to the mail, which may contain information about threats
LanguageData.CommOption_SubscribeScout_SubAlready: [Agreement has already been signed: {0} days to go]
LanguageData.QuestPawn_Title: Greetings! What would you like to discuss?
LanguageData.TakeQuestFromPawnLetterDesc: You have taken the quest "{0}". Additional information on the task can be seen in the Geoscape.\n----------------\n{1}
LanguageData.CommOption_PawnOfferYes: You have accepted the offer. The settler {0} added to your list of colonists. Relations with the {1} faction are also improved.
LanguageData.ActualOnlyThisMap: The offer is relevant while the guest is with you.
LanguageData.CommunicationDialog_Pocahontas: ВYou did not accept a co-residence proposal, which is why your relationship with the {0} faction has been reduced.
